questions.question: ……………………… people believe in ghosts.
questions.description: Before a noun without a determiner, we use most.

questions.question: Has she got ………………………………. friends?
questions.description: In questions we use any some is mainly used in affirmative sentences.

questions.question: …………………………….. key opens the door.
questions.description: Before a noun without a determiner we use neither.

questions.question: …………………………… these answers is correct.
questions.description: We use neither of before a noun with a determiner.

questions.question: ……………………………… my friends wished me on my birthday.
questions.description: None of means not a single one of.

questions.question: I haven’t watched …………………………….. his movies.
questions.description: We use any of before a noun with a determiner.

questions.question: ………………………………. turned up for my party.
questions.description: No one means the same as nobody.

questions.question: I can’t take it ………………………………. longer.
questions.description: No longer is similar to not any longer.

questions.question: ………………………………. his ideas are complicated.
questions.description: We use all of before a noun with a determiner.

questions.question: Can I ask ………………………………. questions?
questions.description: Use 'a few' to mean 'a small number of'.

questions.question: I earn ……………………………. than I used to.
questions.description: Less can be used as an adverb. It is the opposite of more.
